newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Amcol Holdings trial adjourned to Dec 23.
newsitem.headline: Amcol Holdings trial adjourned to Dec 23.

text.p: The court hearing for a trader and a former executive director of Singapore's troubled Amcol Holdings Ltd on Tuesday has been postponed until December 23, court sources said on Tuesday.
The trial was scheduled to start in Singapore's Subordinate Court on Tuesday but the sources said it was given a new date, apparently because the parties were still preparing their cases.

Ng Chee Kheong, 41, and Tay Huay Hong, 49 were charged in October in the Singapore High Court with criminal conspiracy to cheat Amcol into investing US$39.6 million in a now aborted leisure and property development in Mauritius.
Both men pleaded not guilty to charges that carry penalties of up to seven years in jail and were released on bail of Singapore $500,000 (US$357,000).

Ng is accused of receiving a proposal in early April from Maurities businessman Roland Maurel, owner of Sando & Cie, for Amcol to invest US$35.85 million for a 51 percent stake in a joint venture, Guibies Holdings Ltd.

Ng and Tay were alleged to have conspired with another ex-executive director, Lloyd Lochra, whose whereabouts are unknown, to mark up the investment cost of the Mauritius project by US$3.75 million from US$35.85 million.
The inflated amount was to be equally shared among them, according to the charges.
Its board of directors approved Amcol's purchase of 40 percent of the joint venture company for US$39.6 million.

The charge sheets said that in late June, US$300,000 was credited to an account in Banque Central Asia, Indonesia for Ng. They said identical amounts were credited to an account in Coutts & Co, London for Tay, and into a Standard Chartered Bank account for Lochra.
Amcol has been under investigation by Singapore's Commercial Affairs Department regarding payments to various parties, including several former Amcol directors.
